thread.title: Mountain Lakes girls tennis falls in North I Group I title match
thread.title_full: Mountain Lakes girls tennis falls in North I Group I title match

title: Mountain Lakes girls tennis falls in North I Group I title match
text:
Mountain Lakes girls tennis falls in North I Group I title match Daniel Canova , Daily Record 8:32 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 Buy Photo Mountain Lakes first singles Emily Krupnick returns a backhand vs. Leonia in a NJSIAA North 1 Group I tennis final. October 13, 2015, Mountain Lakes, NJ. (Photo: Bob Karp/Staff Photographer) Buy Photo 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
MOUNTAIN LAKES The Mountain Lakes girls tennis team fell to Leonia, 4-1, in the North I Group I title match on Tuesday afternoon. 
Mountain Lakes’ senior Emily Krupnick fell in the 1st singles to Leonia’s Kate Lieber 6-1, 3-6, and 6-10 in the super tiebreaker set. In the 2nd singles, senior Kim Yi lost in straight sets to Liya Davidov, 1-6, 1-6. And in the 3rd singles, sophomore Sanjana Ratakonda also fell in straight sets to Bianca Lieber, 1-6, 5-7. 
“It’s been a great season,” Krupnick said. “We’re 13-2, so we are really feeling good about how we played all season. We still have three more matches and all three matches that we have left are in the conference.” 
In the first doubles match, sophomore Allie Gregorek and freshman Melissa Mao were defeated by Jessica Reich and Elise Kim, 4-6 and 1-6. In the second doubles, Mountain Lakes sophomore Ana Zorlas and junior Grace Chuan defeated Joann Na and Ninna Suh in straight sets, 6-1 and 6-4. Buy Photo 
Mountain Lakes first doubles Allie Gregorek returns a backhand vs. Leonia in NJSIAA North 1 Group I tennis final. October 13, 2015, Mountain Lakes, NJ. (Photo: Bob Karp/Staff Photographer) 
Despite the loss, Mountain Lakes has nothing to hang its head about. 
The No. 1 seed Lakers were the only team from Morris County to play in a sectional final, and heading into the season, Lakers head coach Ginny O’Donnell thought that this would be a rebuilding year for her team. 
“It’s amazing that these girls have done so well, they really fought hard,” O’Donnell said. “Moving forward our goal is to finish the season winning the three conference matches and become conference champions.” 
Mountain Lakes’ remaining conference matches are against Hanover Park, Madison and Parsippany. 
“We are undefeated in the conference,” Krupnick said. “We want it to stay that way.” 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://dailyre.co/1RG71Qb TOP VIDEOS
